originalText.text:
This is a Harlem and New York City jewel. It is a cozy comfortable space with great entertainment and perfectly prepared food. Everything is fresh. The presentation is on point. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious.

Book your reservation now!

text.text:
This is a Harlem and New York City jewel. It is a cozy comfortable space with great entertainment and perfectly prepared food. Everything is fresh. The presentation is on point. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious.

Book your reservation now!

originalText.text:
A landmark positioned in the heart of Harlem connected to Cecil‚Äôs Steakhouse. We went there on an early (6pm) reservation and first Jazz show (7pm). Overall a great experience.

Parking - As any typical NY establishment, parking on the street is next too impossible, however, there is a parking garage about a block away that was reasonable (surcharge for large SUVs). Nice 1 block walk amidst the brownstones and community.

Reservations - We were guests of another party, but our reservation was for 6pm, and they advise they hold for 15 minutes. Due to traffic we got there 6:30 and was still okay. I personally think the earlier the better as it was not packed.

Not sure about walk-in or takeout.

Service was spectacular. Very fast and prompt service for drinks, clearing dishes, and delivery of food.

Food is priced reasonable. The only thing we couldn‚Äôt do which was surprising, was substitute side dishes with our order, as they had an abundance of side options. The food was good, seasoned and cooked well. Dessert assortment was excellent, something for everyone (not just chocolate).

Jazz show - The show started a little late, but it set the ambiance and atmosphere right.

Although small, you cannot tell or feel it when your sitting down eating and enjoying music and fellowship. A definite return in the future.

**Menus attached.

originalText.text:
I really wanted to like this place. I love live jazz and supporting music played in person, especially as we get over the effects of the pandemic on live entertainment. Here‚Äôs my take on Minton‚Äôs.

I was under the impression that this is a historic landmark and storied place. When you walk in, there‚Äôs really no evidence of this. The place is completely renovated and devoid of charm or elegance. I read in a NYT review that men should be encouraged to dress sharp.. but most were wearing casual clothing. It felt more like a cruise ship lounge than a historic venue for jazz music and fine food.

We were also not told of a minimum purchase with each person- $40 per person PLUS an automatically added 20% gratuity and $20 added to support the musicians. I always tip 20% or more but I was not informed when making the reservation that there was a minimum. Our night for four people ended up being over $320 when we had a few appetizers and drinks. Absolutely a rip off and not okay to surprise a guest with these rules. Our party ate beforehand because we didn‚Äôt know about this rule.

What‚Äôs more? The music was okay, but not exceptional. I‚Äôm not a professional, but it was clear that the group performing were good, but not out of the ordinary talented. Patrons were also talking loudly and taking videos/pictures during the performance that clearly got in the way for other guests. Management/Waitstaff should inform the audience to be respectful of others.

I really wanted to like this place but between the rip-off minimum payment and cruise level entertainment atmosphere, this place is a no-go for me. Save your money. Try The Blue Note or another jazz spot for a true experience.

Absolutely a rip off and not okay to surprise a guest with these rules. Our party ate beforehand because we didn‚Äôt know about this rule.

What‚Äôs more? The music was okay, but not exceptional. I‚Äôm not a professional, but it was clear that the group performing were good, but not out of the ordinary talented. Patrons were also talking loudly and taking videos/pictures during the performance that clearly got in the way for other guests. Management/Waitstaff should inform the audience to be respectful of others.

I really wanted to like this place but between the rip-off minimum payment and cruise level entertainment atmosphere, this place is a no-go for me. Save your money. Try The Blue Note or another jazz spot for a true experience.

originalText.text: The history of this place in Harlem is amazing. The newly renovated Minton's is beautiful. Small but spacey enough. You pay 25 dollars per person to watch the jazz show plus dinner and I felt that it was a bit rushed to get you out for the next show. Perhaps the layer show is better to sit and relax and listen to music and eat. The food is delicious
